etymology.description: Pictogram—bag or basket; later borrowed for phonetic value to mean “west”. Compare 東, 束, 鹵; cf. top component of 票.
etymology.interpretation: Originally sketched as a bag or basket, the graph was later repurposed for its sound to write the word meaning “west.” A traditional reading sees a bird settling into a nest, analogized with the setting sun in the west; this view is debated, though some scholars retain it.

examples.chinese: 太阳在西边落下(太陽在西邊落下)。
examples.english: The sun sets in the west.

examples.chinese: 我住在城市的西部(我住在城市的西部)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài chéngshì de xībù.
examples.english: I live in the western part of the city.

examples.chinese: 她喜欢西餐(她喜歡西餐)。
